text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Takeoka was born on May 1, 1971. She played for Nikko Securities Dream Ladies. The club won Nadeshiko League championship for 3 years in a row (1996-1998). However, the club was disbanded in 1998 due to financial strain and she retired. On August 21, 1994, Takeoka debuted for the Japan national team against Austria. She was a member of Japan for 1995 World Cup. She also played at 1995 AFC Championship. She played 3 games and scored 3 goals for Japan until 1995. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 1994 1 0 1995 2 3 Total 3 3 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1971 births Category:Living people Category:Japanese footballers Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Nikko Securities Dream Ladies players Category:1995 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:1995 AFC Women's Championship players Category:Footballers at the 1994 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 1994 Asian Games
title: Inesu Emiko Takeoka
